intro: Andropus, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lobed leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Andropus produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically yellow or red when mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
